Crime_Name: Administrative Error in Visa Application Process
Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer correctly applied s. 78(4) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations in evaluating Mr. Marr's educational credentials
Outcome: The decision was set aside, and the application will be re-examined by another officer within six months
Evidence_Type: Educational credential, years of study, information on Scotland’s education system
Legal_Provision: Section 78(4) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Basis_of_Claim: Insufficient points awarded due to misapplication of regulations regarding educational credentials
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Officer failed to consider special circumstances under s. 78(4), such as shorter education system in Scotland
Regulation_Cited: s. 78(4), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Application_Error: Awarded 15 points instead of 20 for educational credential; did not consider special circumstances despite 13 years of study for a two-year credential
Review_Outcome: Decision set aside; remitted for reconsideration
Evidence_Ignored: Potential relevance of Scotland’s shorter education system to the applicant's study duration
Application_Factor: Possibility of awarding additional points under special circumstances for non-standard study durations
Decision_Outcome: Application refused due to insufficient points
Decision_Review_Issue: Failure to apply s. 78(4) correctly and consider special circumstances
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section 78(4), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Outcome_of_Review: Remitted for reconsideration by another officer
Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient points, partly due to misapplied regulations regarding education
Procedural_Fairness: Officer did not consider all relevant factors, leading to procedural unfairness
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to administrative decision based on incorrect interpretation of regulation
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, s. 78(4)
Procedural_Issue: Failure to consider special circumstances during initial assessment
Omission_Type: Failure to consider applicable regulatory provision (s. 78(4))
